intro: Portulaca coronata, commonly known as the Crown of Thorns, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a succulent species characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, spiny leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Portulaca coronata is drought-tolerant and can survive in harsh environmental conditions.
